name: Sliding Lid Tea Box
description: These tea boxes made from Tasmanian Timber have been hand made to create a small box suitable for storing tea among other things. Each box has been oiled with walnut oil in order to preserve the timber yet make the boxes safe to store tea and food. Each box measures 85mm cubed and has a sliding lid, which completes the simplistic design.

name: Spiral 180 Pendant
description:
Made from Hoop Pine Plywood, chosen for its sustainability credentials as well as aesthetic appeal, this pendant light is suitable for many applications. Spirals 180 serves the function of lighting an area- while still creating a relaxing mood through the pattern of warm, yellow light being pushed through the horizontal slots.

These horizontal slots give the piece its name, through the spiral- like pattern that they form. The light emanating through the slots, highlights my continued interest in the dispersion of light and reflects the alternative sensory world in which I design.

The spirals 180 Pendant light measures 180 milimetres cubed. These lights are also available in other sizes if requested. The unit comes with a pendant unit with a 1.5 metre cord ready for wiring by a licensed electrician

name: Lily Lamp
description:
The Lily Lamp is directly inspired by natural form. It is set on a turned Tasmanian Eucalypt base, which then flows onto a hand-carved bent wood stem. Each stem being hand carved, encourages the observer to appreciate the lamp through touch as well as through sight.

The form of the shade encapsulates three dimensional curves, making porcelain the chosen medium. The lily inspired shade is also translucent when the light is turned on.

Other information:
Dimensions are 500mm tall, base is 160mm.
Each lamp comes wired with an Australian standard plug.

For international enquiries please email info@duncanmeerding.com.au

name: Log Knife Block
description:
These knife blocks are made from a range of different salvaged logs. While the Log Knife Block does not come with knives, a selection of different sized slots has been cut into the logs in order to accommodate a range of knives. Each knife block has been handmade and designed in Tasmania.

Other information:
Dimensions are 250mm x 150mm (Size varies due to the nature of material).

International enquiries please contact info@duncanmeerding.com.au

name: Cracked Log Lamp
description:
The Cracked Log Lamps are made from salvaged logs which would otherwise have been burnt. These lamps embrace, rather than avoid the naturally occurring cracks in refuse logs. By turning them into a vessel for light, we can bring the outside in, and be reminded of our intrinsic connection with nature.

The warm yellow light coming through each lamps unique light pattern highlights the fiery fate that the salvaged timber would have otherwise been exposed to. These lamps embrace the cracks often avoided in timber based designs - pushing the light through the things often associated with darkness. Before turning on the Cracked Log Lamp, often a person would think it is purely just a log of wood.

As well as the standard indoor log lamps, 2 new variations have been developed. One being an outdoor variant (ready for wiring by an electrician) and a wall mounted shade/sconce is ready for hanging over most wall mounted  light sources.

Other information:
Ready wired for Australian power point.
Inline switch.
Includes 75w (equivalent) warm white compact energy saving globe.
Dimensions approximately 250mm x 200mm (Lamps vary due to the nature of material).

International enquiries please contact info@duncanmeerding.com.au
